title: Where is The Great British Bake off filmed and does it change location?
text:
The Great British Bake Off filming location provides a beautiful backdrop to the show (Picture: Mark Bourdillon/ Channel 4)

While the main action on Great British Bake Off takes place inside the famous white baking tent, it wouldn’t be GBBO without beautiful filming locations set against the backdrop of British country houses.

Since the very first series of Great British Bake Off on the BBC in August 2010 with Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood as judges, the series has been filmed in gorgeous settings.

But where is the filming location of the show and does it change every year?

Where is The Great British Bake off filmed?

Every year, the Bake Off tent takes over the grounds of Welford Park in Newbury for 10 weeks while they film the show.

The stately home in Berkshire has been used as the filming location for The Great British Bake since 2014 (because if ain’t broke, don’t fix it.)

Built in the mid 1600s on what was the site of a monastery, Welford Park was a private family home owned by the same family for 400 years.

The park is famous for its snowdrops, which are thought to have been planted by the Norman monks who once lived there.

The house and grounds are now open for the public to explore from January to March, closing just in time for the GBBO team and their baking tent to move in.

Does Great British Bake off change location?

The filming location of the Great British Bake Off used to change location frequently, back when the first series aired nine years ago. The original plan was to have the location changed not just every year – but every week.

In series one, the amateur bakers travelled around the country each week, changing location per episode. So they filmed cakes in the Cotswolds, biscuits in Scotland, bread in Sandwich, puddings in Bakewell and pastry in Cornwall. However, the final Bake Off was filmed in Fulham Palace, London.

A logistical nightmare of grand proportions, the idea to move the show around each week was unsurprisingly scrapped after series one, and in series two Bake Off was based at Valentines Mansion in Redbridge, near London.

Show producers then swapped the Mansion for a beautiful Georgian country house for both series three and four. Harptree Court in Somerset became the show’s new home for these two series before GBBO changed locations one final time and set up shop in Welford Park.

They’ve clearly found the ideal filming location for the show, because Great British Bake Off has been filmed there ever since and didn’t change location when the show moved from the BBC to Channel 4.
